acute_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Acute
acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 1 from 72 hours EbC50=0.0115mg/L of the algae (Green Algae) (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data, 1989).

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: Based on the rabbit LD50 (dermal route) value of 13,300mg/kg (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1998)).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.hazard_name: Acute toxicity Inhalation: Dusts and mists
acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.rationale: Classification cannot be determined, though the available rat inhalation study reported the LC50 value of >1.040mg/L, together with the absence of mortality (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1998)).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_gas.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is a solid according to the GHS criteria and inhalation of its gas is not expected.

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Based on the rat LD50 (oral route) value of 1,150mg/kg (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1998)).

carcinogenicity.rationale: Based on a judgment made by experts in the absence of existing classification, though the available data on carcinogenicity studies in rats and mice provide some evidence of non-genotoxic rat-specific tumor incidence.

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Long-term
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_statement: Very toxic to aquatic life with long lasting effects
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Although acute toxicity is Category 1 and bio-accumulation is low (log Kow=3.52(PHYSPROP Database, 2005)), since there was no rapidly degrading (BIOWIN), it was classified into Category 1.

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data on the substances with melting points of <55degC (melting point: 40.5-41.5degC (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data)).

explosives.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive properties

flammable_gases.hazard_name: Flammable gases including chemically unstable gases
flammable_gases.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

flammable_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

flammable_solids.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data, though classified as flammable according to ICSC (2006).

gases_under_pressure.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Based on negative data in in vivo micronucleus tests on rat and mouse bone marrow cells and in vivo chromosome aberration tests on rat bone marrow cells, though in vitro chromosome aberration tests showed positive (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1998, 2002)).

oxidizing_gases.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_solids.rationale: Organic compounds containing chlorine and oxygen (but not fluorine), with the chlorine and oxygen bound to carbon and hydrogen (but not to other elements)

pyrophoric_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

pyrophoric_solids.rationale: Considered non-pyrophoric when in contact with air at ordinary temperatures, since the substance is stable to heat (up to 150degC) (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data)

reproductive_toxicity.rationale: Based on no evidence of adverse effects on reproduction or offspring development observed in rat 3-generation reproduction studies and rat/rabbit teratogenicity studies (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1980, 1981, 1988)).

self_heating_substances.rationale: Stable to heat (up to 150degC) (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data)

self_reactive_substances.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive or self-reactive properties

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Based on test data from rabbit eye irritation studies (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1998)): "Non-irritating to the eye."

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Based on the evidence of mild irritation with a Draize score of 2.0, observed in rabbit skin irritation tests (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (2000)).

skin_sensitizer.hazard_statement: May cause an allergic skin reaction
skin_sensitizer.rationale: Based on positive results in guinea pig skin sensitization tests employing the Buehler method (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1999)).

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: Containing no metals or metalloids (B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At)

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_statement: May cause damage to organs through prolonged or repeated exposure (liver)
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: Based on the evidence from animal studies including an increase in liver weights/liver-to-body weight ratio, fatty degeneration of the liver, and bile duct hyperplasia (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1998)). These effects were observed at dosing levels within the guidance value ranges for Category 2.

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: No symptoms or signs referable to specific target organs were observed in the available animal studies (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1998)).
